page.title: 11NATURE IN THE WOLDS (contd)
page.content: Domesticated ducks have been "released" on the banks of the River Soar, at and near Barrow-Upon-Soar: new Mallard cross breeds have established themselves including Aylesbury ond Khaki-Campbell mixtures. The Barn Owl is becoming scarce in this area as old farm buildings are being demolished and are replaced by Dutch Barns. Tawny Owls and Little Owls are also affected. Kestrels are common but Sparrowhawks and other hunters are rare : the wide use of insecticides is one of the factors in their demise, chemicals are taken in through the food chain and infertile eggs result.
